alert.note: Alert for Cherokee (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 05 at 8:31PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of south central Cherokee County through 900 PM EDT... At 831 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Canton, moving southwest at 5 mph. HAZARD...Up to 40 mph wind, frequent cloud to ground lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Canton, Woodstock, Holly Springs, Buffington, Hickory Flat, Lebanon and Bridgemill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
